articles.description: England's Deputy Chief Medical Officer said the definition of "close contact" depends on both time and physical distance
articles.content:
In less than two months, our region and the rest of the UK has adopted "social distancing" to try to stop the spread of coronavirus. 
With the country in total lockdown, we have been urged to stay at least two metres away from anyone outside our household. … [+3797 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus: 'Covid toe' and other rashes puzzle doctors - BBC News
articles.description: A Spanish study identifies five rashes present in some coronavirus hospital patients.
articles.content:
Image copyrightCOVID-piel studyImage caption
 "Covid toe" is a rash that can look like chilblains
Five rashes, including Covid toe, are affecting some hospital patients diagnosed with Covid-19, a small study by Spanish doctors has found.

articles.title: Five new cases of coronavirus recorded in Hartlepool as one more patient has died at the town's hospital trust - Hartlepool Mail
articles.description: There have been no more confirmed cases of coronavirus in Hartlepool but sadly four more patients being treated at hospitals run by the town’s NHS trust have died.
articles.content:
According to figures by Public Health England, there have been no new positive test for Covid-19 in Hartlepool in the 24 hours before 9am on Sunday morning (May 3) meaning the total remains at 197.

articles.author: Rebecca Speare-Cole
articles.title: Gay and bisexual men excluded from donating plasma to Covid-19 trials at London hospital - Evening Standard
articles.content:
Gay and bisexual men have reportedly been told they cannot donate their plasma to coronavirus trials at a London hospital.
A potential treatment for Covid-19 using plasma from recovered patients is to be trialled by doctors at Guy's and St Thomas' hospital.… [+13325 chars]

articles.content:
England's health secretary Matt Hancock has announced that the UK Government has hit its target of 100,000 daily tests, hailing it as an "incredible achievement".

articles.title: Coronavirus: Scientists conclude people cannot be infected twice - Sky News
articles.description: A total of 277 patients in the country were believed to have fallen ill for a second time, as had patients in China and Japan.
